apple-cake.title: Apple Cake
pars: Bernadette had used a mini muffin tray and simply tossed them in cinnamon and sugar. Cute and yummy! I did a dozen mini muffins and cooked the rest in a loaf tin. I think it worked better as mini muffins.
ingredients: 3 or 4 cooking apples peeled, cored and roughly chopped
enough milk to make into a fairly stiff batter
method: Mix all together to form a lumpy mixture.
Place in a greased roasting pan or lamington pan and bake in a moderate oven about 1 hour - or until cooked when tested.
While hot, spread with butter and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Serve hot with cream or custard for a dessert, or cold as a slice.

chocolate-special-occasion-cake.title: Pam’s Chocolate Special Occasion Cake
pars: I didn’t make it, but I ate it, together with the other members of the Colbo Exercise group (CAFÉ) and it really WAS delicious.
ingredients: 3/4 cup hot strong coffee (2tsp of instant coffee)
method: Stir hot coffee gradually into cocoa. Mix together 1 1/4 cups sugar with butter and egg yolks, salt, vanilla and 1/2 the coffee/cocoa mixture. Beat till light and creamy. Mix bicarb and sour cream together. Add butter and sugar, sour cream mixture and cocoa and coffee, alternately with sifted flour. Beat egg white to stiff, gradually adding 1/2cup sugar to stiff peaks and fold into cake mixture.
Grease and line deep greased 9-10 inch tin. Bake in a mod oven for 60-70 minutes (Pam says 50 minutes did hers).
Cool, cut through middle and fill with whipped cream. Spread frosting on top and decorate with walnuts and cherries - or strawberries (as was MY birthday cake). Thank you, Pam!

chocolate-special-occasion-cake-frosting.title: Pam’s Chocolate Frosting
method: Melt chocolate over hot water, cool lightly and stir in salt and sour cream.
